snippet: The Obama administration gave away some of its leverage when it announced multibillion-dollar arms sales deals with Iraq and Saudi Arabia.
abstract: Editorial asserts that the Obama administration may have forfeited leverage it needs to nudge the governments of Iraq and Saudi Arabia toward less destructive policies in its haste to complete multibillion-dollar arms sales to both countries; asserts that America's strategic interest must trump any sales strategy.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration gave away some of its leverage when it announced multibillion-dollar arms sales deals with Iraq and Saudi Arabia.
